reviewText: Not bad, especially for prime members since it is free.  If you have an interest in this subject, it is pretty good. Don't take the version of some of the incidents in the movie as set in stone and representing exactly how things actually happened. As with all these types of movies, there is always some literary license given to tell the story. Just as with all witnesses, each have their own version of the facts. It tells the story and makes it work in the 1 1/2 hour time frame they had to tell it.The movie stops at The Book of the New Covenants which Ervil wrote behind bars before his death. That is only half the story. Some members of his family picked up where he left off with his death and continued to enforce blood atonement of those he listed in that book. If you are interested in the subject material of the Church of the Lamb of God, Ervil and his followers after Ervil died, I suggest reading Scott Anderson's book,The 4 O'Clock MurdersIt is well worth the price new or used. It is arguably the best single account of the sordid events after he died.  Although, again one must understand it is based on who's version of the events was used in the book.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The movie well conveyed what Ervil was about. It's sad how some can be led by a clearly silly man into criminal activity who should by right be avoided and ignored. But that's the way the cookie crumbles. Such activities have been going on historically for thousands of years. One incredibly juvenile man can lead a whole fleet of people into whatever calamity he chooses to. In the Bible, this social phenomenon is described allegorically as Azazel."Go Azazel. For your dominion is over those who are with you."
summary: A good portrayal of a true life character.

reviewText: Being that this was an older movie it was O K. But Brian Dennehy put on a great performance here. Since it is based on a true story it shows how false prophets can brain wash people's minds. They get talked into killing innocent people because the "False Prophet" says so and misguides them with the Holy Bible. It just takes one leader to take the sheep to the slaughter like Hitler did, Osama Bin Laden and countless others. Beware of these people and stick to what you believe in and not them!
summary: Prophet of Evil: The Ervil LeBaron Story  Brian Dennehy

reviewText: Movie is old, but relevant and a good streaming print.  Dennehy is so versatile an actor that he can play the evil monsters as well as the gentle spirit.  One of his best characters and the story line is based on true events so interesting for the "can't believe this" lover of this genre.

reviewText: I give all movies at least a 20 minute grace period. If there is any redeeming quality (such as more than one "A" actor) then maybe 10 minutes more. Unfortunately this movie didn't make it past the 25 minute marker.This actually could have been a better movie if there was some build-up, character development & one or two explanations as to just why this "prophet" was so powerful. It was not believable as a cult-religious con/terrorist movie because there was way to understand any of the relationships -- almost immediately there are ordered hits on members of the own group for petty reasons. The multiple wives smiling serenely in the background. The prophet has 12 wives and over 40 children. This information is given in one sentence. In two scenes lasting about 30-45 seconds each, the prophet decides to take another wife -- a very young woman who is already in love with someone else -- and just by proclaiming it so, they are married.At one point the police who are trying to "get" LeBaron mention that his group has about 50 members. I was unsure how this worked out -- 12 wives, 40 children, plus himself, the man that was killed, the woman killer, a baby and the woman sitting serenely & in another scene, a 10-ish year old boy,  is already 58 -- and it seems reasonable to expect there are others who follow, otherwise, how or why does this man have any power?So the plot is just faulty and scattered all over the place. Obviously a made-for-TV movie. Perhaps it has just enough of the bare backbones for distracted stay at home moms and the unemployed. I just cannot imagine for the life of me, that this movie was ever in the box office.To watch this movie, the average person would need to get acquainted with some Latter Day Saint denominations, including the FLDS Church, who are famous for having multiple wives & being fairly prosperous. Getting some knowledge as to how men are evaluated to have more than one life and a higher position in the church is valuable in maybe trying to "get" this movie. Warren Jeffs is someone to google  (as he was the prophet of the Latter day Saints)  to maybe get an idea as to how this self-proclaimed prophet personality works.But, meh... that seems like an awful lot of work for a freebie AP movie.
summary: Just couldn't get into this one
